title: Wrangell - St Elias National Park & Preserve: Audio Tours
body: Audio Tours          The Nabesna Road Audio Tour Are you planning to visit the Nabesna Road? Are you curious about geology or history? Would you like to learn more about the Boreal Forest or the animals that live there? If so, check out the Nabesna Road Audio Tour! This is a narrated tour of the Nabesna Road that plays in your vehicle's CD player. You can download the audio tour for free or pick up a free CD at the Wrangell-St. Elias National Park & Preserve visitor center or Slana Ranger Station.   Download the Nabesna Road Audio Tour script (pdf format, 284 KB). Download the Nabesna Road Audio Tour tracks (mp3s - right click on the link and choose "Save Target As" option to download directly to your computer).   Slana Ranger Station to Slana River Bridge  Slana River Bridge to 4-Mile Road Junction  4-Mile Road Junction to the Park/Preserve Sign at Mile 5.6  Park/Preserve Sign at Mile 5.6 to Copper Lake Trailhead  Copper Lake Trailhead to Dead Dog Hill  Dead Dog Hill to Caribou Creek Trailhead  Caribou Creek Trailhead to Rock Lake Rest Area  Rock Lake Rest Area to the Camping Area at Twin Lakes  The Camping Area at Twin Lakes to Lost Creek Trailhead   Lost Creek Trailhead to Jack Creek Rest Area   Jack Creek Rest Area to Skookum Volcano Trailhead   Skookum Volcano Trailhead to Reeve's Field   The End of the Road!   Wrangell-St. Elias National Park Visitor Center, in Copper Center    Chitina, the McCarthy Road, and Kennecott Mill Town   Conservation and Research Efforts in Wrangell-St. Elias National Park & Preserve
